channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unauthorised lock box attached to lamppost, 1st November
item.description:
An unmarked lock box is attached to street lighting column 210 15 outside the 64 Sancroft St. For at least a year, people have been coming regularly to access it, often creating noise and disturbance, especially late in the evening. Please could the highways/street lighting team inspect, confirm whether this attachment is authorised, and remove it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sancroft Street, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on red route, 1st November
item.description:
Multiple cars parked on a red route. Narrowing road, causing queues making it dangerous to drive especially at night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Vale, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive Number of Potholes, 1st November
item.description:
Again and again Bexley council ignoring the pot holes that are on this stretch of road. Same old excuse, we have no money. Sort it out!! People are swerving in the road to avoid and it’s an accident waiting to happen
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed frame/mattress in the 3rd lane, 1st November
item.description:
Half a bed frame and mattress I believe in the 3rd lane on the A13. I had to swerve the items luckily all fine but will cause an accident! The location may be slightly off as have me a bit of shock but it’s between just before the tilbury turn off and the Orsett turn off
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A13, Grays
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HMO dumping again, 1st November
item.description:
We are sick of having HMOs in our street and having to put up with persistent dumping. Get rid of these kinds of people and unscrupulous landlords!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Piedmont Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light flickering, 1st November
item.description:
Street light flickering and may be doing this all day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merewood Close, Bickley, London

item.title: Dumpy furniture in street, 1st November
item.description:
Partial blocking pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durban Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Road needs sweeping, 1st November
item.description:
Build up of grit and dirt in cycle lane and road. Needs sweeping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Abandoned suitcase, 1st November
item.description:
Abandoned suitcase next to pedestrian traffic light on Woolwich Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 396, Woolwich Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Nit Planted, 1st November
item.description:
This recently planted tree is not properly supported. It will fall on a car or die. It needs to be done better. Many of the trees recently planted in this neighbourhood are the same. Whomever is delivering this service for you is not doing an adequate job. This surely cost the council a lot of money to acquire the tree and have it planted, seems a shame that might be wasted because the labour/workmanship is shoddy. Find a new contractor who might do it once properly??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Inglewood Road, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge Flytip of rubbish, 1st November
item.description:
Huge Flytip of rubbish, please remove

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Minden Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and abandoned bin between 30 and 36 Camberwell Rd, 1st November
item.description:
This bin in the alley between 30 and 36 Camberwell Rd SE5 has been abandoned for literally years. The fly tipping in and around it is a clear hazard and fire risk. The bin should be removed, the area cleared and the adjoining businesses and premises instructed not to dump or leave anything there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unlawful Parking Contra Flow Cycle Lane, 1st November
item.description:
Now that Town Park is closed in the dark, I use Sydney Road contra flow. Unfortunately, may drivers park on footpath and in cycle lane here - especially dangerous as it is a contra flow lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Sydney Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gardening rubbish dumped - not by residents, 1st November
item.description:
Big pile of garden rubbish dumped here but not by residents. Can this be removed please. We don’t know who left it there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169 - 175, Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside #17 Blocked Drain, 1st November
item.description:
This drain is blocked and has been for at least six months. It is full of leaves. Water cannot drain properly through it. It is not serving its purpose. It needs to be cleared. You have been notified before.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Pandora Road, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unlawful Parking on Shared Surface, 1st November
item.description:
All the way along Palmers Green at various points, but especially outside The Alfred Herring & Bus Stop across road, there will be drivers blocking pavements & cycle lanes. So easy to enforce, but it is not being done and is very dangerous for vulnerable road users. I tweet about it every single cycle commute at this point.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unlawful Parking - Almost every single evening, 1st November
item.description:
All the way along Palmers Green at various points, but especially outside Triangle Car Sales and Milk & Honey, there will be drivers blocking pavements & cycle lanes. So easy to enforce, but it is not being done and is very dangerous for vulnerable road users. I tweet about it every single cycle commute at this point.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bottom of Streatley road, 1st November
item.description:
Lots of household rubbish - plastic bag, clothes, shelves…. Now bags are being open by people and lots of rubbish spreading everywhere… hope you can find the culprits through CCTV and fine them!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Fly tipped waste lining the pavement., 1st November
item.description:

item.title: Drivers Blocking Cycle Lane & Pavement, 1st November
item.description:
Often encounter drivers blocking pavement & cycle lane here. Zero enforcement in morning or after 7pm when cycle commuting home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 765, Green Lanes, Edmonton, London
